channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is Zohran Mamdani a Lifelong Socialist?
item.description: The New York City mayoral candidate is trying to soft-sell his radicalism.

item.title: Suspense surrounds Senate vote on Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' as July 4 deadline looms
item.description: Senate Republicans are on schedule to pass President Trump's "big, beautiful bill" on Monday, but whether enough votes exist to do so is a nail-biter.

item.title: North Carolina Sen. Thom Tillis, facing Trump primary threat, will not seek reelection in 2026
item.description: North Carolina Sen. Thom Tillis, a Republican who has clashed with President Trump, announced Sunday he will not run for reelection next year.

item.title: Blow Up Washington, D.C.’s Brutalist Buildings — and the Sooner, the Better
item.description: They are a tribute to soulless monumentality and a gut punch to the human spirit.

item.title: Republican senate tax bill would add $3.3 trillion to the U.S. debt load, CBO says
item.description: The changes made to President Donald Trump's big tax bill in the Senate would pile trillions onto the nation's debt load while resulting in even steep...

item.title: Republicans dismiss Democrats' warning that changes to Medicaid will leave millions uninsured
item.description: Congressional Republicans on Sunday embraced the proposed changes to Medicaid in the "big, beautiful bill" that Democrats and a few GOP lawmakers warn...

item.title: Star witness against Kilmar Abrego Garcia won't be deported, court records show
item.description: Court records show that the Trump administration has agreed to spare from deportation a key witness in the federal prosecution of Kilmar Abrego Garcia...

item.title: Democracy in the Workplace Is Under Threat
item.description: Minorities of workers are choosing union representation for 100 percent of their colleagues. This is against the spirit of the law.

item.title: The Obergefell Slippery Slope Was Real
item.description: There was a germ of radicalism even in arguments for gay marriage that presented themselves as conservative.

item.title: Schools Are Erasing America’s Story. Parents Must Rescue It
item.description: America is drifting into collective amnesia regarding our history. That indifference isn’t accidental.

item.title: 5 Times The Trump Administration Had Fun With The News This Week
item.description: From the United States successfully bombing Iran’s nuclear sites to several Supreme Court wins, the news cycle this week has been a wild ride. Preside...

item.title: University Of Virginia’s DEI-Obsessed President Resigns In Disgrace

item.title: One Year Ago, Media Lies About Biden Blew Up On Live National Television
item.description: June 27 really needs to be a national holiday wherein we collectively observe the bottomless depravity of the dying news media. We could call it somet...

item.title: From The World Of John Wick: Ballerina Signals A Hollywood Retreat From Obnoxious Girlbosses
item.description: Audiences are tired of obnoxious girlbosses -- rightly so -- but this film doesn't deserve to suffer for the missteps of previous productions.
